    • Method Detail

      • readUTF8

        public static java.lang.String readUTF8(java.lang.String filename)
        Reads a UTF-8 encoded text file into a string. Reads a UTF-8 encoded file into a string one page (4096 bytes) at a time. When the entire file is read, returns a string that contains the file contents. This method is useful for reading plain text files and XML files.
        Parameters:
        filename - UTF-8 encoded file to read
        Returns:
        String containing the file data. When the file does not exist, or there was a problem reading the file, returns null.

      • writeUTF8

        public static boolean writeUTF8(java.lang.String filename,
                java.lang.String data)
        Writes a string to a UTF-8 encoded text file. Converts the provided string to UTF-8 and writes it to a UTF-8 encoded text file. Creates the file if it does not exist; overwrites the file when it does exist.
        Parameters:
        filename - UTF-8 encoded file to write the string to
        data - String to append to the UTF-8 encoded file
        Returns:
        True when the data string is correctly appended, false when there is an error writing to the file

      • appendUTF8

        public static boolean appendUTF8(java.lang.String filename,
                 java.lang.String data)
        Appends a string to a UTF-8 encoded text file. Converts the provided string to UTF-8 and appends it to a UTF-8 encoded text file. Creates the file if it does not exist.
        Parameters:
        filename - UTF-8 encoded file to append the string to
        data - String to append to the UTF-8 encoded file
        Returns:
        True when the data string is correctly appended to the file, false when there is an error writing to the file
